results.title: Avalon: the 1992 Australian International Air Show
results.creator_credit: Apocalypse, Aerospace Foundation, Airshows Downunder, Neil Brown, Cathie Scott and Geoff Tanner
results.brief_description: In October 1992 the largest gathering of aircraft in Australia took place at Avalon Airport, Victoria. The five day air show was the biggest ever held in the Southern Hemisphere. A complete range of aircraft operated by the Australian Defence Forces, general aviation aircraft, warbirds, recreational and sport aircraft, airliners, antiques, balloons, radio-controlled models, hang-gliders and helicopters have all been recorded in static or spectacular flying displays on this video. Presented by Jeff Watson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Apocalypse, Aerospace Foundation, Airshows Downunder, Neil Brown, Cathie Scott and Geoff Tanner

results.title: Avalon
results.creator_credit: Bandai Visual Company, Media Factory, DENTSU, Nippon Herald Films, Atsushi Kubo and Mamoru Oshii
results.brief_description: In a future world, young people, disheartened by their bleak reality, are increasingly becoming addicted to an illegal (and potentially deadly) battle simulation game called Avalon. Ash (Malgorzata Foremniak) is a ruthless “Class A” fighter and reigning queen of the games who suspects a conspiracy at play and decides to face-off the ruthless programmers. Using highly stylized computer graphics, director Mamoru Oshii (Ghost in the shell), presents an exhilarating psychological science-fiction thriller, that, with its dystopian setting, has the hallucinatory logic of a disturbing, if atmospheric, computer game.

results.title: Avalanche (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Filmed on location in the Austrian Tyrol, AVALANCHE is an action packed tale of adventure on a snow holiday. Despite strict regulations imposed by their teacher, two boys set out to climb the mountain. Disaster and gripping drama follow. Rated: G

results.title: Auxiliary views: single auxiliaries
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films and Pathescope Company of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Engineering Drawing”.
Begins with a brief review of the principles of orthographic projection and goes on to show that the three views obtained by projection on the three principal planes do not represent the true shape of some surfaces of an object that has one or more slanting faces. This condition is shown to require projection of the slanting surface on a plane which is parallel to it and not one of the principal planes. Thus auxiliary projection is explained and defined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: McGraw-Hill Films and Pathescope Company of America

group_siblings.title: Auxiliary views: double auxiliaries

results.title: Auxiliary views: double auxiliaries
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films and Pathescope Company of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Engineering Drawing”.
Begins with a quick view of orthographic projection on three principal planes and on auxiliary planes; then points out that a new condition is introduced if the object to be drawn has a slanting face that is not perpendicular to any of the principal planes. The film shows why a single auxiliary view does not give an accurate picture of an oblique face. The theory of double auxiliary or oblique view is then described in detail, using the visualization effects of combined animated drawings and animated models.

results.title: Auxiliary views. Pt. 1
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mechanical Drawing”.
Begins by showing that the three principal views do not represent the true surface of an object that has one or more slanting faces. This condition is shown to require projection of the slanting surface on a plane which is parallel to it and is not one of the principle planes. This auxiliary projection is explained and defined. No other credits available.

results.title: Autumn tale = Conte d'Automne
results.creator_credit: Canal+, La Sept Cinema, Rhone-Alpes Cinema, Sofilmka, Margaret Menegoz and Eric Rohmer
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Tales of the four seasons = Contes des quatre saisons”.
The final instalment in Eric Rohmer’s “Tales of the four seasons” quartet of films looks at a later life romance. Friends and family of the widowed Magali decide that it is time she was matched up with a new lover. Beautifully filmed in the vineyards of the Rhone Valley. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Autumn sonata
results.brief_description: The reunion of an internationally famous concert pianist and her married daughter begins on a hopeful note, but too many old hurts and bitter memories conflict with their love for each other. Long-buried resentments between mother and daughter soon explode in a shattering confrontation of painful truths. Starring Ingrid Bergman and Liv Ullman.

results.title: Autumn of a mining town
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Joe Scully and Phillip Mark-Law
results.brief_description: Perhaps due to its fascinating past and equally astonishing present, the Victorian gold rush town of Ballarat catches the quintessence of Victorian Australia - the curious old homes; the old tramcars; the coffee palace; the Cobb & Co office; the gardens and the people. No narration. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
